alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; De Baca County; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Estancia Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:10PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...MAINLY DRY SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LINCOLN, SOUTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL, WEST CENTRAL DE BACA, SOUTHEASTERN SANTA FE, SOUTHEASTERN SOCORRO, GUADALUPE AND TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 408 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered showers and thunderstorms from the Central Highlands southward across western Lincoln County. Individual storms were moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Ruidoso, Santa Rosa, Estancia, Capitan, Carrizozo, Vaughn, Willard, Corona and Encino. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 203 and 293. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 310 and 346. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 171 and 266. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 209 and 299. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 30 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
